intro: Schultesia aptera var. multidentata, commonly known as the multidentate schultesia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features a trailing growth habit with opposite, lanceolate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent corona. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
